item.description:
I'm planning to do the Hancocks (North and South) on  Monday, July 4th.  Both Hancocks are 4,000 footers.   I will be watching the weather all day to make sure that the conditions don't worsen.  Right now, I am planning on going.  I will make a final decision regarding the weather this evening.

========================================

This Meetup is ON as long as the weather forecast holds for tomorrow.   

================================================

WHY HIKE THE HANCOCKS WITH US ON INDEPENDENCE DAY?

============================================

1.  It is Independence Day and Hancock has the best signature on the Declaration of Independence.

2.  Trail food & a climb is healthier than hot dogs, hamburgers and Aunt Susie's potato salad.

3.  Your relatives will all be in one place together and suddenly being in the middle of the woods, relatively alone, seems like a good idea.

4.  You need these peaks.

5.  Mondays are your lucky hiking day.

6.  You haven't hiked with US  (Kate, Kelby and Loki) yet!

7.  You HAVE hiked with us before and miss us desperately!

================================================

This will be a moderately paced hike - I'm not a fast hiker but I do keep moving and average about book time.  We've been hiking all weekend, so I do not expect to be faster than book time tomorrow.

We will take the Hancock Notch Trail to the Cedar Brook Trail to the Hancock Loop trail - total mileage (round trip) is 9.8 miles and about 6 hours and 15 minutes.  

Because of the distance and elevation involved please demonstrate (via the RSVP questions) that you have been hiking similar mountains recently.

My hikes are always dog-friendly.  However, make sure to bring extra water for the dogs.  I will have both dogs with me - they need these peaks too!

I will post trail specifics from the AMC guide shortly.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Be prepared for cool temps, rain and potentially poor weather conditions.   The forecast for Monday does involve showers.  DO NOT WEAR COTTON OR DENIM. This is dangerous especially in cool/wet weather. If you have questions about how to prepare or how to dress, ask them in advance.

Answers to FAQs 

  • This is NOT a traverse, so we WILL NOT have to carp ool.  
  • We will meet in the lot for the HANCOCK NOTCH TRAIL HEAD, located near the hairpin turn in the Kancamagus Highway.
  • Sunset on Monday will be at 8:30 pm. 
  • Headlamps are not required for this hike, but strongly suggested as a safety precaution.  Always be prepared to come out in the dark if necessary.
  • Bring plenty of water
  • This hike is very wet and we expect at least a little rain - come prepared to stay dry.
  •  This hike is not very exposed.
  • We will NOT pass a shelter or an AMC hut.  
  • We will START AND FINISH TOGETHER. If you cannot hold your speed down to match that of the group (if necessary), this is not the hike for you.  I require that hikers in my group wait at trail junctions and at summits to allow the group to make decisions and reset their pace along the way.
  • I (Kate) am not a speedy hiker, but I do keep a steady pace. 
  • If the conditions are prohibitive, I have no qualms about turning around. The mountain will be there another day.  I want you to be be around for another day too.
  • I will watch the weather carefully and post weather updates during the week leading up to the hike. I rely on NOAA and MWObs for my forecasts.

Most of the payoff comes in the form of fabulous views and enjoying the outdoors so, if the weather looks like it will be miserable or dangerous, we will reschedule. Please plan accordingly.

RSVP Questions are not optional - I may delete your 'going' RSVP and/or will not take you from the waiting list if I don't see your answers.   If you do not provide me with a phone number to try and contact you on the morning/evening of the hike (if necessary), we will NOT wait for you at the trailhead.

I will provide attendees with my cell phone number in advance of the hike.

Book time is about  6 hrs, 15 min  & 9.8 miles 

 

Plagerized Trail Descriptions for your benefit 
---------------------------------------------------------- 
Copyright © the Appalachian Mountain Club. All rights reserved do not distribute

Hancock Notch Trail to Cedar Brook Trail

1.8 miles, 1 hour 5 minutes, 400 feet.

 

Cedar Brook Trail to Hancock Loop Trail

.7 miles, 25 minutes, 200 feet

 

Hancock Loop Trail



Total Time/Mileage:  9.8 miles, 6 hours, 15 minutes

------


DISCLAIMER: MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY, WINTER HIKING OR MOUNTAIN RESCUE. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN (OR EXPERIENCED OR EVEN CAUSED) IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I HAVE NOT CLIMBED THESE PEAKS BEFORE AND HAVE DONE ALL MY RESEARCH VIA GUIDEBOOKS, INTERNET AND ADVICE FROM OTHER HIKERS, SO IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME INFORMATION IS NOT ACCURATE. I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
item.how_to_find_us: Green Honda Civic, usually a Meetup Sign in the window & 2 dogs
item.name: NH 48: Hancocks
